intro: Trukia macarthurii, commonly known as the MacArthur's trukia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
